headline.print_headline: Turkey and Egypt Seek Alliance Amid Upheaval of Arab Spring
headline.seo: Turkey and Egypt Look to Team Up Amid Tumult
headline.main: Turkey and Egypt Seek Alliance Amid Region’s Upheaval

docs.snippet: Turkey and Egypt have turned to each other for support, looking to build a partnership that could represent a significant geopolitical shift....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Egypt and Turkey are considering plans to lift visa restrictions and have completed joint naval exercises in the Mediterranean Sea, andTurkey has offered host of measures to bolster Egypt’s economy, including $2 billion aid package; each country seems to need the other in alliance that could shape region for decades to come and help it emerge from tumult of Arab revolutions.
docs.lead_paragraph: Turkey and Egypt have turned to each other for support, looking to build a partnership that could represent a significant geopolitical shift.

headline.print_headline: 6-Year Sentence for Informer in Corruption Case
headline.seo: Informer in New Jersey Corruption Case, Solomon Dwek, Is Sentenced to 6 Years
headline.main: 6-Year Sentence for Informer in Corruption Case

docs.snippet: Solomon Dwek, the informer in New Jersey’s biggest corruption sting, wore a wire for the government and helped snare more than 40 defendants in a variety of cases....
docs.abstract: Solomon Dwek, informer in New Jersey's largest corruption sting operation, is sentenced to six years in prison despite recommendations by prosecutors for leniency and a lighter term; Dwek wore a wire for the government and helped snare more than 40 defendants in a variety of cases.
docs.lead_paragraph: Solomon Dwek, the informer in New Jersey’s biggest corruption sting, wore a wire for the government and helped snare more than 40 defendants in a variety of cases.

headline.print_headline: Challenging the Reputation of Hospital Food on a Rooftop Farm
headline.seo: Challenging the Reputation of Bland Hospital Food on a Rooftop Farm
headline.main: Challenging the Reputation of Hospital Food on a Rooftop Farm

docs.snippet: Although hundreds of hospitals across the country host a farmer’s market or have a garden on their grounds that supplies fresh produce, hospital rooftop gardens are still rare in New York....
docs.abstract: Stony Brook University Hospital in Suffolk County, Long Island, is using a rooftop farm to feed patients and challenge the reputation of hospital food as mushy, tasteless and devoid of nutrients; hundreds of hospitals across the country use similar farmer's markets or their own gardens, but hospital rooftop gardens are still a rarity in the New York area.
docs.lead_paragraph: Although hundreds of hospitals across the country host a farmer’s market or have a garden on their grounds that supplies fresh produce, hospital rooftop gardens are still rare in New York.

headline.main: Rodriguez Says He Has No One to Blame but Himself

docs.snippet: After the Yankees’ defeat to the Tigers Thursday, Alex Rodriguez apologized for his horrible postseason performance, professing his desire to remain a Yankee and vowing to play better next season....
docs.abstract: New York Yankees third baseman Alex Rodriguez takes full responsibility for being benched in final two games of American League Championship Series against Detroit Tigers.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the Yankees’ defeat to the Tigers Thursday, Alex Rodriguez apologized for his horrible postseason performance, professing his desire to remain a Yankee and vowing to play better next season.

headline.print_headline: Missouri Political Donor Thrives With No Limits
headline.seo: Missouri Political Donor Thrives With ‘No-Limits’ Giving
headline.main: Missouri Political Donor Thrives With No Limits

docs.snippet: The possible future of unlimited campaign contributions is on display in Missouri, where Rex Sinquefield has emerged as the biggest giver....

keywords.value: Citizens United v Federal Election Commission (Supreme Court Decision)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Retired investor Rex Sinquefield is a singularly powerful force in Missouri politics, spending $20 million since 2008 to advance various candidates and causes; lawyers and activists who pushed for the Supreme Court's Citizen's United decision are now hoping to persuade Congress to repeal federal caps on direct donations, move that would only increase the influence of men such as Sinquefield.
docs.lead_paragraph: The possible future of unlimited campaign contributions is on display in Missouri, where Rex Sinquefield has emerged as the biggest giver.

docs.lead_paragraph: Four townships are challenging a state regulator’s decision to withhold their payments from a gas drilling levy.
